dt: {bc}a musical composition for a single voice or instrument with or without accompaniment
{bc}the featured part of a concerto or similar work
{bc}a performance in which the performer has no partner or associate {bc}something undertaken or done alone
{bc}any of several card games in which a player elects to play without a partner against the other players

shortdef: a musical composition for a single voice or instrument with or without accompaniment
the featured part of a concerto or similar work
a performance in which the performer has no partner or associate : something undertaken or done alone

dt: {bc}to fly an airplane without one's instructor on board
{bc}to climb (something, such as a mountain) alone

shortdef: to perform by oneself: such as
to fly an airplane without one's instructor on board

dt: {bc}a climb in which a climber uses no artificial aids for support and has no rope or other safety equipment for protection in case of a fall

dt.t: Before attempting his {wi}free solo{/wi} of Moonlight Buttress, [Alex] Honnold rehearsed the most challenging pitch on rope repeatedly, until he had memorized each move.

He's attempting to do something that professional rock climbers have long thought was impossible—a "{wi}free solo{/wi}" ascent of the world's most iconic cliff. That means he is alone and climbing without a rope as he inches his way up more than half a mile of sheer rock.

utxt.t: Aside from good sneakers and a bit of friction-inducing chalk on the palms, there is nothing to prevent a {wi}free soloist{/wi} from a fatal fall.
Honnold … has become the world's pre-eminent {wi}free soloist{/wi}, traveling around the world to scale seemingly unscalable mountains.

shortdef: a climb in which a climber uses no artificial aids for support and has no rope or other safety equipment for protection in case of a fall
